items.description: Check out the latest brokerage calls and analyst comments on the stocks in action today. Our coverage includes stocks like GMR Airports, Varun Beverages, Oil India and 360 One, along with views on the RBI's latest monetary policy outcome.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty indicates a strong start; US, Asian markets gain
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Wall Street stocks advanced on Wednesday with the S&P 500 and the Dow scoring record closing highs after the release of Federal Reserve meeting minutes and ahead of September inflation data and the earnings season. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 431.63 points, or 1.03%, to 42,512.00. The S&P 500 gained 40.91 points, or 0.71%, at 5,792.04 and the Nasdaq Composite climbed 108.70 points, or 0.60%, to 18,291.62.

items.title: Stock Radar: Britannia, Adani Enterprises, PNC Infratech, TCS, GR Infraprojects, Rain Industries in focus on Thursday
items.description: GTPL Hathway, Sonata Software, JM Financial, Indian Railway Finance Corporation, Zee Entertainment Enterprises, Star Health and Allied Insurance Company, and Craftsman Automation will be in focus on October 8.

items.title: Adani Enterprises stock in focus as company launches first tranche of QIP to raise $500 million
items.description: Adani Enterprises stock is in the spotlight as the company launches the first tranche of its QIP offering to raise $500 million, with plans for further fundraising in the coming months to support capital expenditure and debt repayment

items.title: Agri Picks Report October 10, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, The National Commodity and Derivatives Exchange has dropped Ramgunjmandi in Rajasthan as an additional delivery centre for its coriander (symbol: DHANIYA) futures contracts from November, it said in a release.

items.title: Market Minutes|Will markets snap out of bear grip amid positive cues? Defence stocks, Adani Enterprises in focus
items.description: In this episode of Market Minutes, Harshita Tyagi discusses the key factors driving the markets today. Benchmark indices are set for a positive start following global cues. Defence stocks will be in the spotlight after India cleared two crucial defence deals, while Adani Enterprises and Britannia are among other stocks to watch. On a somber note, India lost one of its most revered industrialists last night as Ratan Tata passed away. Catch market expert Anil Rego in the Voice of the Day segment. Market Minutes is a morning podcast that puts the spotlight on hot stocks, key data points, and developing trends.

items.title: Bernstein limits PB Fintech's downside at $100 million if healthcare foray falters
items.description: Policybazaar parent--PB Fintech has announced plans to allocate $100 million for a 30 percent stake in a new healthcare venture.

items.title: Ratan Tata commanded infinite P/e; the value he brought to business was immeasurable, says Madhusudan Kela
items.description: India has no shortage of successful industrialists, but few have matched the legacy of the Tata Group

items.title: PNC Infratech stock jumps 5% on winning Rs 2,091 crore project near upcoming Navi Mumbai Airport
items.description: Shares of PNC Infratech Ltd surged over 5 percent after the company was declared the lowest bidder by CIDCO for a Rs 2,091 crore infrastructure project near Navi Mumbai Airport, marking a significant boost in investor sentiment.

items.description: The broader market, entailing the mid and small caps, also edged higher after rising 0.4 and 0.6 percent, respectively.

items.title: HAL, Mazagon Dock, BDL other defence stocks gain as CCS clears defence deals worth Rs 80,000 crore
items.description: Defence stocks, including HAL, BEL gained after the Cabinet Committee on Security approved deals worth Rs 80,000 crore for 31 Predator drones and two nuclear submarines, significantly enhancing India's military capabilities.

items.title: Live: Will Nifty make a decisive comeback on weekly expiry day? TCS Q2 earnings today | Opening Bell
items.description:
Asian markets open higher after Wall Street notches new highs. S&P 500 and Dow hit new highs ahead of US CPI data. FOMC minutes: Officials were divided on whether to cut rates by half a point in September. GIFT Nifty signals a strong start. US 10-year yield stays above 4% as traders digest Fed meeting minutes. US crude closes below $74 per barrel after sell-off; Brent below $77. Gold eases for sixth session as dollar marches upward. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Chandan Taparia, Senior VP, Head - Derivatives & Technical Research, Motilal Oswal and Rishi Kohli, CIO - Hedge Fund Strategies, InCred Alternative Investments.

#sharemarket #stockmarket  #marketopening

items.title: Star Health Insurance stock falls 2.5% after massive data breach
items.description: An unidentified hacker, who attempted to sell sensitive customer data, alleged that it was Star Health's chief information security officer who sold him the information.

items.title: GTPL Hathway stock slips 3% after sharp plunge in Q2 profit
items.description: GTPL's net profit slumped 63 percent on year to Rs 12.7 crore in Q2, down from Rs 34.2 crore in the year ago period.

items.title: Oil India shares rise 3% as Motilal Oswal reiterates 'buy' on attractive valuations
items.description: Oil India is leveraging new technologies to increase production, the Motilal Oswal report stated.

items.title: High interest in Tata Group stocks: Tata Investment Corp, Tata Chemicals stocks rise up to 10%
items.description: Investors have rallied behind Tata stocks following the passing of Ratan Tata, with Tata Investment, Tata Chemicals and others seeing gains of up to 10 percent.

items.title: Rain Industries shares surge 9% as arm inks pact to develop anode materials for EV batteries
items.description: The partnership between Rain Industries' subsidiary and Canada's Northern Graphite aims to develop advanced battery anode material (BAM) for lithium-ion batteries utilized in electric vehicles.
